Authors: Karsten-Welker, Adienne Alena : {https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0562-7393} * Haller, Alexander : {https://orcid.org/0009-0006-8685-3507} * Hohenfeld, Christian : {https://orcid.org/0000-0002-8587-8052} * Timm, Henning : {https://orcid.org/0000-0002-5345-7122} * Uzun, Hüseyin : {https://orcid.org/0009-0005-4968-3564} * Jacob, Juliane : {https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0443-3570} * Krägelin, Karl-Ulrich : {https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0189-8049} * Bossert, Lukas C. : {https://orcid.org/0000-0003-3076-3968} * Cyra, Magdalene : {https://orcid.org/0000-0001-7738-2703} * Sommer, Maike * Schröder, Max : {https://orcid.org/0000-0003-1522-494X} * Parks, Nicole Andrea : {https://orcid.org/0000-0002-6243-2840} * Kling, Philipp * Stimberg, Sebastian * Gaida, Sven * Richter, Thomas * Fingerhuth, Matthias : {https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0248-8914}
Title: Welcome to the ELN Material Collection
Description: The ELN Material Collection project strives to collect useful materials, reports, etc. for the use of electronic lab notebook (ELNs). As a self-organized community effort, collaboration in the form of feedback, links to materials, or merge requests with changes are very welcome. Since this initiative was started by an eLabFTW user group organized by fdm.nrw it currently has a strong focus on eLabFTW. If you are new to eLabFTW and would like a short introduction to the software, please refer to the section Software Information. Material for other ELNs is welcome as well.

Authors: Karsten-Welker, Adienne Alena : {https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0562-7393} * Haller, Alexander : {https://orcid.org/0009-0006-8685-3507} * Hohenfeld, Christian : {https://orcid.org/0000-0002-8587-8052} * Timm, Henning : {https://orcid.org/0000-0002-5345-7122} * Uzun, Hüseyin : {https://orcid.org/0009-0005-4968-3564} * Jacob, Juliane : {https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0443-3570} * Krägelin, Karl-Ulrich : {https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0189-8049} * Bossert, Lukas C. : {https://orcid.org/0000-0003-3076-3968} * Cyra, Magdalene : {https://orcid.org/0000-0001-7738-2703} * Sommer, Maike * Schröder, Max : {https://orcid.org/0000-0003-1522-494X} * Parks, Nicole Andrea : {https://orcid.org/0000-0002-6243-2840} * Kling, Philipp * Stimberg, Sebastian * Gaida, Sven * Richter, Thomas * Fingerhuth, Matthias : {https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0248-8914}
Title: eLabFTW – a web-based white paper approach to support modern lab documentation
Description: Usage concept and AdvantagesWhite paper approach: All elements in eLabFTW, i.e. experiments and resources can contain a textual description using a WYSIWYG editor (What you see is what you get). In addition, references to other experiments, resources can be created as well as files attached.Metadata-Input: Despite the textual description, each element in eLabFTW can be annotated with metadata that can be inserted, e.g. by an automatically generated form. Technically, the metadata fields and information is stored in an attached JSON file.

Description: This section provides a brief overview about the chapters in this section as well as a general description of how different institutions run the software. If you are familiar with eLabFTW in general and want to install it at your institution start here.

Title: ELN Material Collection - Installation : Ansible
Description: Ansible facilitates the installation, updates, and maintenance of target systems (managed nodes) from a central control node. Both the control node and the managed nodes can be physical servers or VMs. Installation processes are described in so called playbooks defining a list of ansible roles that perform a specific task. Updates and installations can be deployed to several nodes at once.

Title: ELN Material Collection - Installation : Kubernetes
Description: Kubernetes (K8s) is an open-source container orchestration platform that automates the deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications. Kubernetes is widely used for large setups and requires a certain initial investment in the software and concepts.

Title: ELN Material Collection - Legal Aspects : IT Security Concept
Description: Security involves many aspects and partly depends on the desired protection and chosen trade-offs. This makes it difficult to present one "cookie-cutter" aproach and it is advised to tread security more as a process that needs ongoing attention of a person. At the bottom of this chapter we link to an example TOM-Paper where we hope you find many points that you can incorporate into your own security concept.

Title: ELN Material Collection - Legal Aspects : Impressum
Description: The obligation to include an imprint applies to service providers as specified in Section 5 of the Telemedien-Gesetz (public entities, individuals, or legal entities) who offer commercial telemedia, typically for a fee. It is irrelevant whether the service providers offer their own telemedia or those of third parties, or simply provide access to such media for users.For example, an imprint or a link to the institution's imprint can be entered under the "Policies" tab in the SysAdmin panel.Below is a template adapted from the RWTH Aachen University Impressum for Coscine

Authors: Karsten-Welker, Adienne Alena : {https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0562-7393} * Haller, Alexander : {https://orcid.org/0009-0006-8685-3507} * Hohenfeld, Christian : {https://orcid.org/0000-0002-8587-8052} * Timm, Henning : {https://orcid.org/0000-0002-5345-7122} * Uzun, Hüseyin : {https://orcid.org/0009-0005-4968-3564} * Jacob, Juliane : {https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0443-3570} * Krägelin, Karl-Ulrich : {https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0189-8049} * Bossert, Lukas C. : {https://orcid.org/0000-0003-3076-3968} * Cyra, Magdalene : {https://orcid.org/0000-0001-7738-2703} * Sommer, Maike * Schröder, Max : {https://orcid.org/0000-0003-1522-494X} * Parks, Nicole Andrea : {https://orcid.org/0000-0002-6243-2840} * Kling, Philipp * Stimberg, Sebastian * Gaida, Sven * Richter, Thomas * Fingerhuth, Matthias : {https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0248-8914}
Title: ELN Material Collection - Legal Aspects : Personalrat (English: Staff Council)
Description: It's best to transparently cooperate with the staff council at the very beginning of the process of acquiring an ELN.The topic of work tracking is central for ELNs with respect to the Staff Council. Time stamp visibility varies depending on the ELN, while solutions such as eLabFTW are very transparent in this regard. As such, changes made to experiments or entities in general within the ELN are documented with a time stamp and are visible to other members of the team, depending on the individual settings of the entity (see below). It is important to be clear with users that these time stamps do not serve as a method of tracking employees' work. The terms of use should also mention that this is not permissable.Furthermore, a team admin policy can help in clarifying rights, roles, and use of the ELN and may be required by the staff council.The following can aid in communicating these aspects with the work council before implementing the software.

Title: ELN Material Collection - Legal Aspects : Data Protection and Terms
Description: A protection policy outlines how data is processed and which data may be stored in the ELN, while the terms of use outlines under which terms the service may be used.  Your University may provide templates for data privacy/protection policies. contact your data protection officer for assistance.

Title: ELN Material Collection - FAQ
Description: This page covers frequently asked question concerning the usage of eLabFTW from a user perspective. Also consult your local institution for additional information and the offical dokumentation FAQ.
